alert.note: Alert for Yuma (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Phoenix (Central Arizona and California Desert)
info.headline: Dust Advisory issued August 25 at 3:43PM MST until August 25 at 5:45PM MST by NWS Phoenix
info.description: The National Weather Service in Phoenix has issued a * Dust Advisory for... Southwestern Yuma County in southwestern Arizona... * Until 545 PM MST. * At 342 PM MST, a wall of dust was along a line extending from 16 miles south of Wellton to 21 miles south of Ligurta to 32 miles south of Fortuna Foothills, moving northwest at 15 mph. HAZARD...Less than three miles visibility with strong wind in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Doppler radar. IMPACT...Hazardous travel. * This includes the following highways... AZ Interstate 8 between mile markers 4 and 35. AZ Route 95 between mile markers 29 and 43. AZ Route 195 between mile markers 5 and 26. Locations impacted include... Yuma, Fortuna Foothills, San Luis, Wellton, Blaisdell, Kinter, Ligurta and Araby. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Blowing dust brings reduced visibility, leading to dangerous driving conditions. If driving, avoid blowing dust if possible. If caught in dense blowing dust, pull off the road, turn off your lights and keep your foot off the brake. Motorists should not drive into an area of blowing dust. PULL ASIDE STAY ALIVE!
